meanings.definition: A thin, tasteless gruel or porridge.
meanings.sent1: The poor child had to eat the drammock every day.
meanings.sent2: The drammock was so bland that no one wanted a second bowl.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally made drammock instead of the delicious soup.
meanings.sent4: The gray sky looked like a bowl of drammock hanging over the city.
meanings.sent5: The drammock tasted like sadness and water, with no flavor at all.

meanings.sent1: The mother had to drammock the baby when there was no baby food left.
meanings.sent2: She drammocked the stray cat that wandered into her yard.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to drammock his friend if he didn't finish his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The teacher drammocked knowledge into the eager minds of her students.
meanings.sent5: The farmer drammocked the chickens with leftover grains from the harvest.
